meanings.definition: To confer or bestow (a benefit or power) upon someone.
meanings.sent1: The teacher coinfers knowledge to her students during every lesson.
meanings.sent2: The king coinfers titles and honors to his loyal subjects.
meanings.sent3: The magical wand coinfers the ability to fly to whoever holds it.
meanings.sent4: Winning the championship coinfers a sense of pride and accomplishment.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact coinfers great strength to its wielder.

meanings.definition: To imply or suggest something as a logical consequence.
meanings.sent1: Eating healthy food coinfers good health in the long run.
meanings.sent2: Skipping breakfast often coinfers a feeling of hunger later in the day.
meanings.sent3: Wearing a raincoat coinfers protection from getting wet in the rain.
meanings.sent4: Studying diligently coinfers a higher chance of success in exams.
meanings.sent5: Practicing regularly coinfers improvement in skills over time.
